articles.title: Researchers Discover Fossil of New Species of Pangolin in Europe - University of Arkansas Newswire
articles.description: The humerus bone of a new pangolin species was found at Grăunceanu, a famous Pleistocene fossil deposit in Romania, confirming its existence in Europe.
articles.content:
Photo by David BrossardModern-day pangolins exist in Asia and Africa. Eight species of living pangolins range from vulnerable to critically endangered.

articles.title: Study reveals widespread impact of COVID-19 pandemic on maternal and newborn care in Europe - News-Medical.Net
